name: Mercy USA for Aid and Development
mission: Mercy-USA for Aid and Development is dedicated to alleviating human suffering and supporting individuals and their communities in their efforts to become more self-sufficient. Our philosophy is "Helping People Help Themselves".  Incorporated in the State of Michigan in 1988, Mercy-USA's projects focus on improving health, nutrition and access to safe water, as well as promoting economic and educational growth and providing disaster relief around the world.
programs: Education Services for Visually Impaired Children
theoryOfChange: Stated focus on improving health, nutrition and access to safe water, and promoting economic and educational growth around the world to support individuals and communities in becoming more self-sufficient.

evaluationSources: #11 Best Non Profits companies to work for in Michigan (Zippia)

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mercyusa.org/zakat (Source: https://mercyusa.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

amalEvaluation.charity_name: Mercy USA for Aid and Development

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: masakin (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 43/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Increase operating reserves to reduce continuity risk; set a board-approved minimum (typically at least 3 months).
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: Mercy-USA for Aid and Development, Inc. shows exceptional alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mercyusa.org/zakat (Source: https://mercyusa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Mercy-USA has a Charity Navigator score of 92.33333333333333/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 96.3%.
The organization is Zakat-eligible and follows specific policies for Zakat distribution.
The organization reported total revenue of $54,067,823 and fundraising efficiency of $0.02 per $1 raised.
Mercy-USA provides nutrition support and health services for children and mothers in Somalia.
The organization constructed modular homes and maintains high TB cure rates.
Programs include cistern rehabilitation and the distribution of winter warmth packages.
The organization tracks the number of people benefiting from safe water initiatives.
Mercy-USA provides food aid in Syria and operates TB cure centers in Somalia.
Donors can specifically choose Zakat as a giving method through the organization's website.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Mercy-USA earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial efficiency and direct impact on urgent humanitarian crises. Its Zakat-eligible status and focus on high-urgency regions make it a strong fit for Muslim donors.
areas_for_improvement: Limited working capital of 0.8 months, which may impact long-term financial flexibility during funding gaps
Opportunity to increase transparency regarding specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics across all programs

dimension_explanations.alignment: Mercy-USA is highly aligned with the needs of Muslim donors as a Zakat-eligible entity that adheres to specific asnaf categories for distribution [2][9]. The organization addresses high-urgency humanitarian needs in Syria and Somalia, maintaining a long-standing track record of service in these regions [4][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high impact through direct provision of services, such as building modular homes and rehabilitating water cisterns [5][6]. Its health programs in Somalia have achieved notable success in TB cure rates, and its safe water initiatives provide long-term sustainability for local communities [7][8].

baseline_narrative.headline: Mercy-USA for Aid and Development provides life-saving nutrition, health services, and sustainable water solutions to vulnerable populations in Somalia, Syria, and beyond.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 96.3%, ensuring maximum funding reaches those in need
Highly efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.02 per $1 raised
Strong track record in specialized health services, including high TB cure rates in Somalia
baseline_narrative.summary: Mercy-USA for Aid and Development, Inc. is a humanitarian organization dedicated to crisis relief and sustainable development, specifically focusing on maternal and child health in Somalia [1][4]. With a total revenue of $54,067,823, the organization maintains a high level of financial efficiency by directing the vast majority of its resources toward direct program services [1][3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Mercy-USA earns a strong overall rating due to its high financial efficiency and direct impact on urgent humanitarian crises. Its Zakat-eligible status and focus on high-urgency regions make it a strong fit for Muslim donors.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently holds <cite id="7">0.8 months of working capital</cite>, which is below the recommended minimum for long-term financial flexibility.
The charity has experienced a <cite id="8">-8.6% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>, indicating a recent contraction in funding.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains exceptional fundraising efficiency to maximize the impact of incoming donations.
case_against.summary: Financial metrics show some vulnerabilities, including a <cite id="4">96.3% program expense ratio</cite> which is below the <cite id="9">89.8% peer median</cite>, and limited working capital.

confidence.notes: Strong data availability with verified ratings and financials.

alignment.explanation: Strong fit for Muslim donors as it is <cite id="3">ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE</cite> and operates in high-need humanitarian crisis zones.
alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust this charity due to its <cite id="6">92.33333333333333/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility further, the charity could publish more detailed cost-per-beneficiary metrics.

impact.explanation: Operations show a <cite id="4">96.3% program expense ratio</cite> with highly efficient fundraising at <cite id="5">$0.02 per $1 raised</cite>.
impact.improvement: Increase operating reserves to reduce continuity risk; set a board-approved minimum.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Some outcome tracking through Candid

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct implementation of programs rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: Mercy-USA for Aid and Development provides life-saving nutrition, health services, and sustainable water solutions to vulnerable populations in Somalia, Syria, and beyond.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill their zakat obligations by supporting established humanitarian relief efforts in major crisis zones.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with confidence
Care deeply about humanitarian crises affecting Muslims globally
Value established organizations with a long history of delivery
giving_considerations: The organization has a lower program expense ratio than some peers
Working capital is limited, meaning consistent donor support is crucial
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking organizations with high financial reserves or those focused exclusively on domestic US programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization tracks basic output metrics like people served and homes built, but lacks rigorous third-party RCT evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Programs are aimed at improving health, nutrition and access to safe water, as well as promoting economic and educational growth.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real, measurable improvements in beneficiary lives.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With limited working capital and recent revenue contraction, the organization has high capacity to absorb additional funding for its ongoing humanitarian programs.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Somalia, Syria, Gaza, Yemen, Kenya, Lebanon

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its specific focus on maternal and child health in regions like Somalia.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian relief with a domestic presence
similar_organizations.name: ICNA Relief

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger secular organization with similar healthcare focus
similar_organizations.name: Save the Children Federation

similar_organizations.differentiator: Specialized medical relief with massive global scale
similar_organizations.name: Doctors Without Borders

strengths.detail: The organization is highly efficient in its development efforts, spending only <cite id="5">$0.02 per $1 raised</cite>.
Mercy-USA is <cite id="3">ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE</cite> and serves multiple asnaf categories including fuqara and masakin.
The charity has earned a <cite id="6">92.33333333333333/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and maintains a 100% independent board.

strengths_deep_dive: Mercy-USA demonstrates strong institutional credibility through its long history, having been founded in <cite id="1">1988</cite>. The organization has built a robust infrastructure for delivering direct humanitarian aid, particularly in health and nutrition. Its financial accountability is highlighted by its <cite id="6">92.33333333333333/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and its ability to maintain operations with a <cite id="4">96.3% program expense ratio</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: Mercy-USA for Aid and Development is a humanitarian organization founded in <cite id="1">1988</cite> that provides life-saving nutrition, health services, and sustainable water solutions to vulnerable populations. The organization reported <cite id="2">$54,067,823 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. As a <cite id="3">ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE</cite> charity, it directs funds to critical humanitarian needs across multiple countries, including Somalia, Syria, and Gaza. The organization maintains a <cite id="4">96.3% program expense ratio</cite> and demonstrates exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending just <cite id="5">$0.02 per $1 raised</cite>. Mercy-USA holds a <cite id="6">92.33333333333333/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite> and has achieved a Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid.
